Detailed Description

configuration management class, using a database backend

### NOT YET FUNCTIONAL ###

Class cannot be used directly, you need to subclass it in your application service class folder

Member Function Documentation

qcl_config_db::create ( $  name,
$  type,
$  permissionRead = null,
$  permissionWrite = null,
$  allowUserVariants = false 
)

creates a config property, overwriting any previous entry requires permission "qcl.config.permissions.manage"

Parameters:
string $name The name of the property (i.e., myapplication.config.locale)
string $type The type of the property (string|number|object|boolean)
string $permissionRead The permission name that is needed to access and read this property (optional)
string $permissionWrite The permission name that is needed to access and read this property (optional)
boolean $allowUserVariants If true, allow users to create their own variant of the configuration setting
Returns:
id of created config entry

qcl_config_db::set ( $  name,
$  value,
$  defaultValue = false 
)

sets config property

Parameters:
string $name The name of the property (i.e., myapplication.config.locale)
string $value The value of the property.
boolean $defaultValue If true, set the key's default value for keys that allow user variants. This is necessary so that the admin can change the defaults instead of editing her/his own variant.
Returns:
true if success or false if there was an error
